intro: Saracha miersii, commonly known as the Miers' saracha, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine by local communities. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Saracha miersii is considered a vulnerable species.
